info.name: NetWork 19.1
info.description:
You"ll find the latest postman Collection and environment variables in my Github repository:
https://github.com/juergenschubert/DELLEMC-DPS-ReST-api/tree/master/NetWorker/19.1

Please download the postman_collection.json and the postman_environment.json and import into your postman runing on your system.

Root directory will be:
https://github.com/juergenschubert/DELLEMC-DPS-ReST-api

request.description:
Find out your NetWorker IP address as well as login and Password. We will need it later.
To store it permanently right klick the folder authentication and navigate to the authorization tab. NetWorker will use basic auth.
That is the NetWorker ReST api entrypoint we"ll use the rest of this webcast.

You"ll find the latest postman Collection and environment variables in my Github repository:
https://github.com/juergenschubert/DELLEMC-DPS-ReST-api/tree/master/NetWorker/19.1

Please download the postman_collection.json and the postman_environment.json and import into your postman runing on your system.

Root directory will be:
https://github.com/juergenschubert/DELLEMC-DPS-ReST-api

JSON Editor Online - view, edit and format JSON online
https://jsoneditoronline.org/

We are discussing here the introdcution of
Filer and query.
Filter (fl) for filtering what will come back. So filter to see onyl requestion ressources

and uery to query ressources for a special ressource. Like onyl the infromation from a special client
See what ploicies your networker server does have today right now ?
See what ploicies your networker server does have today right now ?

item.name: Create New Protection Group - Type: Client

request.description:
We wann create a new Protection Group. But how?
We have seen that with  https://jsoneditoronline.org/ we can view the swagger file. But where to add the infromation and what to include.
First go and insert the NW Swagger file into the jsond online editor. Search in the editor for "protectiongroups" and just navigate to that one in
"object > path > protectiongroups". Here you" find the information you need for that POST.

item.name: Update Protection Group - with new Content

request.description: Make sure you have update the policyId variable in you environment you are using.

item.name: DELETE Protection Group - Type: Client Copy

request.description: Make sure you have update the policyId variable in you environment you are using.

DemoCenter you can use> sql-01.demo.local
Make sure you can do a nslookup of the client you created. If not create an entry into NetWorkers hostfile under:
>notepad %windir%\system32\drivers\etc\hosts
entster the ip from the NW Server with a hostname
192.168.1.11 	nwdemo.demo.local
feed postman variable {{NWClient_id}} with NW ClientID
Copy and paste from the last query the RessourceID from that client

feed NWClient_id with the client you wanna backup  

https://192.168.1.59:9090/nwrestapi/v3/global/clients/86.0.147.94.0.0.0.0.6.37.9.93.192.168.1.59/op/backup
Find a pool we can use for backup !!
Epoch  translator > https://www.epochconverter.com/

item.name: VM Backups - Items of protected UUID

request.description: Search for the **/op/vmount** entry. Parameters we can use:

search for the **/op/vmount** entry.
Parameters we can use:

	"backupDeviceExportPath": "NetWorker Server name",
	"installFlrAgent": true,
	"targetVCenterHostname": "vcenter01.demo.local",
	"targetVmAdminUserId": "Administrator",   ---needs to be loacal admin as it"s doing the mount
	"targetVmAdminUserPassword": "Password123!",
	"targetVmMoref": "vm-896",   Moref of the VM
	"targetVmName": "SQL-01",
	"targetVmUserId": "Administrator",
	"targetVmUserPassword": "Password123!",
	"uninstallFlrAgent": false,
	"vProxy": "NW-vProxy01.demo.local"
	
	In the jason look for 
	object > path > /vmware/vcenters/{vcenter-hostname}/protectedvms/{vm-uuid}/backups/{backup-id}/op/vmmount
	
	Parameter 0: vcenter-hostname
	Parameter 1: vm-uuid
	Parameter 2: backup-id
	Parameter 3: in the body the backupOpVmMount schemalookup as #/definitions/BackupOpVmMount
	
	Lookup the backupOpVmMount in 
	object > definitions > BackupOpVmMount so the properties tell you what you need  
	
	https://192.168.1.20:9090/nwrestapi/v3/global/vmware/vcenters/vcenter01.demo.local/protectedvms/501123d1-0cba-d9af-bb3f-5f5937023d0c/backups/89bac572-00000006-ff07c71c-5d07c71c-00025000-a5990156/op/vmmount

Look for 
"state": "SessionActive"
"vProxyMountState": "Unmounted"
With IdleTineout Parameter

it is a /op/recover for instance access

Body
 
{  
	"recoverMode": "Instant",  
	"vmName": "SQL-01",  
	"vCenterHostname": "vcenter01.demo.local",  
	"vProxyHostname": "NW-vProxy01.demo.local",  
	"datacenterMoref": "datacenter-21",  
	"clusterComputeResourceMoref": "domain-c267",  OR "CompureRessourceMoref":"domain-s26",   
	"hostMoref": "domain-s26",  
	"powerOn": false,  
	"reconnectNic": false  
}

https://github.com/juergenschubert/DELLEMC-DPS-ReST-api/tree/master/NetWorker/VMWare.  
Get infos from: https://vcenter01.demo.local/mob

it is a /op/recover for instance access

definition does include   
"operator": "Equals","DoesNotEquals", "Contains", "DoesNotContains", "StartsWith", "DoesNotStartsWith"  
"property": "Name" or "Path"
"type": "VirtualMachine", "Cluster", "vApp", "VmFolder", "Datacenter","ResourcePool"
"value": "Oracle"
